description: Easy, hearty beef stew with no need to brown the beef first.
ingredient: [{"name": "beef chuck stew meat", "units": "pounds", "amount": 3}, {"name": "kosher salt", "units": null, "amount": "1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon"}, {"name": "olive oil", "units": "tablespoons", "amount": 3}, {"name": "celery", "units": "ribs", "amount": 5}, {"name": "onion", "units": "medium", "amount": 1}, {"name": "carrots", "units": "medium", "amount": 4}, {"name": "parsnips", "units": "medium", "amount": 2}, {"name": "black pepper", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": "0.5"}, {"name": "fresh thyme leaves", "units": "tablespoon", "amount": 1}, {"name": "all-purpose flour", "units": "tablespoon", "amount": 1}, {"name": "beef broth", "units": "cups", "amount": 4}, {"name": "water", "units": "cups", "amount": 2}, {"name": "balsamic vinegar", "units": "tablespoon", "amount": 1}, {"name": "Worcestershire sauce", "units": "tablespoon", "amount": 1}, {"name": "russet potatoes", "units": "pounds", "amount": 1.5}, {"name": "fresh parsley leaves", "units": "cup", "amount": 0.25}]
step_by_step: ["In a large bowl, season the beef pieces with 1 tablespoon of the salt.", "Heat the olive oil in a large pot over high heat.", "Add the beef all at once and cook, stirring occasionally, until the meat is no longer pink, about 10 minutes.", "Add the celery, onion, carrots, and parsnips. Reduce heat to medium-high. Season with remaining teaspoon of salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Cook until most of the liquid has evaporated, about 10 minutes more.", "Add the thyme and flour, stir, and cook until raw flour is no longer visible, about 30 seconds.", "Add the beef broth, water, balsamic vinegar, and Worcestershire sauce. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low and cook, partially covered, until stew has thickened slightly, about 1 hour.", "Add potatoes to the stew, stir well, and continue to simmer until the potatoes and beef are tender, about 30 minutes.", "Season to taste, transfer to serving bowls, sprinkle with parsley, and serve."]
notes: Refrigerate leftovers, tightly covered, for up to 5 days. Stewed potatoes do not freeze well.
